articles.title: 2025 Clinical Proteomics on a Chip Conference (CPCC)
articles.excerpt: The CPCC forum focuses on the innovation and application of protein microarray technology in precision medicine.
articles.content:
The 'Clinical Proteomics on a Chip Conference' (CPCC) is hosted by the High-Throughput Protein Microarray Technology and Biomedical Industry Service Alliance. Based in Taiwan, this forum is dedicated to promoting the innovation and application of protein microarray technology in the field of precision medicine.

**Forum Goals:**
- Build a world-class high-throughput platform.
- Connect clinical research with the biomedical industry.
- Analyze antibody-drug binding profiles.
- Assist in biomarker discovery and off-target assessment.

The forum will focus on the latest applications and trends in proteome microarrays, sharing the Alliance's research results and innovative technologies.

articles.title: 2025 7th Joint Conference on Multi-Omics and Precision Medicine (MOPM) Successfully Concluded!
articles.excerpt: The HitLab team participated in the MOPM conference, sharing our vision for 'Biomedical GPUs' and the future of wafer-based proteomics.
articles.content:
On the weekend of November 8-9, 2025, the NCKU HitLab team brought decades of experience and passion for precision medicine to the 7th Joint Conference on Multi-Omics and Precision Medicine (MOPM) in Taipei. 

We shared key insights on 'Proteomics' and our core vision: using Wafer-Based Mechanism Proteomics as the 'GPU of the Biomedical World' to propel disease diagnosis and exploration into a new era of 'Real-time and Precision'. 

We believe that through collaboration with medical partners (we have already collaborated with major teaching hospitals across Taiwan), we can accelerate the clinical application of these technologies.

articles.title: Mastering Future Trends: Industrialization and Expansion of Innovative Technical Services
articles.excerpt: A new interdisciplinary course by the Food Safety Institute teaching how to transform lab technology into scalable market services.
articles.content:
Have you ever imagined how cutting-edge laboratory technology can be transformed into hot services in the market? 

This course, 'Industrialization and Expansion of Innovative Technical Services', focuses on entrepreneurship, unique business design, technology translation, complex B2B business models, practical Minimum Viable Service (MVS), and forward-looking platform strategies. 

**Course Highlights:**
- **Practical Orientation:** Learn to develop innovative technologies from a single service concept into a scalable platform.
- **Strategic Thinking:** Deep dive into 'Lean Startup' and 'B2B Business Design'.
- **Hands-on Implementation:** From market pain point interviews to professional Pitch Decks.
- **Interdisciplinary Co-creation:** Encouraging students from engineering, medicine, life sciences, management, and social sciences to team up.

**Instructors:** Chen Jiansheng, Qiu Shifeng.

articles.title: Review: 2025 Antibody Drugs and 20th Advanced Biomedical Knowledge Symposium
articles.excerpt: HitLab showcased our High-Throughput Protein Microarray technology at the National Biotechnology Research Park.
articles.content:
The NCKU HitLab team participated in the 'Antibody Drugs and 20th Frontiers in Biomedical Sciences Conference' held on May 26-27, 2025, at the National Biotechnology Research Park. 

The event, co-hosted by the Biomedical Translation Research Center of Academia Sinica, the Taiwan Antibody Association, and the Professor Lin Rongyao Academic Education Foundation, attracted numerous professionals from industry, government, and academia. 

Our team set up a booth to actively introduce High-Throughput Protein Microarray technology services to experts, clinical medical professionals, and the biotech industry. We highlighted our capabilities in:
- Precise analysis of antibody specificity
- Broad analysis of protein interactions using proteome chips
- Support for drug target analysis and disease biomarker screening

articles.title: Protein Microarray Technology: Leading Solution for High-Throughput Analysis
articles.excerpt: An in-depth look at Protein Microarray technology, its types, production process, and wide-ranging applications in biomedical research.
articles.content:
Protein Microarray is an advanced high-throughput technology capable of simultaneously analyzing the expression, binding capabilities, and functional activities of thousands of proteins. By immobilizing large quantities of proteins on a solid surface, we can rapidly acquire information on protein-protein interactions and biological activities.

**Types of Protein Microarrays:**
- **Analytical Arrays:** Use antibodies or aptamers for quantitative analysis of protein expression.
- **Reverse Phase Protein Microarrays (RPPA):** For detecting specific proteins and post-translational modifications in cell lysates.
- **Functional Arrays:** Study interaction activities and enzymatic functions.

**Applications:**
- Protein-Protein Interaction Studies
- Post-Translational Modification Analysis
- Biomarker Identification
- Antibody Specificity Analysis

articles.title: About the Alliance: Bridging Industry and Academia
articles.excerpt: The High-Throughput Protein Microarray Technology and Biomedical Industry Service Alliance is dedicated to accelerating precision medicine.
articles.content:
The 'High-Throughput Protein Microarray Technology and Biomedical Industry Service Alliance' is committed to promoting the application of high-throughput protein microarray technology in the biomedical field. We build a platform for industry-academia cooperation to accelerate progress in precision medicine, antibody screening, disease diagnosis, and biomarker development.

**Our Mission:**
- Provide high-throughput protein production and microarray technology to support clinical research.
- Construct a blood antibodyome biomarker bank.
- Provide customized microarray chip services.
- Promote industry-academia collaboration to develop new microarray technologies.

articles.title: Core Service Solutions: From Chips to Clinical Research
articles.excerpt: Explore our comprehensive range of services including Protein Microarray Chips, Clinical Research, and Drug Target Analysis.
articles.content:
We offer a comprehensive suite of core services designed to meet the needs of modern biomedical research:

**Protein Microarray Chips:**
State-of-the-art whole-genome protein microarrays covering 4,300 E. coli, 5,800 Yeast, and 21,000 Human proteins on a single wafer. This allows for precise analysis of antibody antigens and biomarker discovery.

**Clinical Research & Diagnosis:**
Screening for disease biomarkers to promote the development of precision medicine.

**Drug Target Analysis:**
Developing target analysis technologies to assist pharmaceutical companies in new drug development, mechanism of action studies, and drug response prediction.

**Antibody Microarray Chips:**
Suitable for AKT, MAPK signaling pathway analysis and biomarker research.
